physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 7-month-old African American boy with eczematous rash and cold abscesses on left forearm and right thigh; elevated serum IgE 1177 IU/mL; elevated eosinophil count 383/mm3.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 8 months of age, the serum IgE increased to over 5000 IU/mL and the eosinophil count was elevated at 121/mm3; treatment with cyclosporine led to clinical improvement in eczema.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 15-year-old Caucasian boy with mildly eczematous skin and 6 cold abscesses; elevated serum IgE levels at 15,900 IU/mL; elevated absolute eosinophil count at 226/mm3.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had long-standing HIES with intermittent episodes of abscesses but has maintained good control of the condition with treatment.
